intro: Scopolia atropoides, commonly known as black cohosh, is a flowering plant native to the forests of North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its dark purple flowers and rhizomatous root system. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three deeply lobed leaflets, and it produces showy, fragrant blooms in late spring. Scopolia atropoides is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
